poem:
**Cosmic Echo**

A trillion whispers stitched  
the sky—a bright seam slipped  
from another galaxy's tongue.  
Matthew, under the southern cross,  
blinked at the absurdity, this  
secret volleyed light—an echo  
impossibly distant  
caught in our earthly net,  
and the universe, in its  
glorious largesse,  
winked back with $250,000.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Australian astrophysicist’s $250,000 prize for field-changing discovery a ‘nice surprise’ When Prof Matthew Bailes and his collaborators discovered a mysterious flash from a galaxy far, far away, he thought it was “too good to be true”. It was 2007, and the scientists had come across an “absurdly, insanely bright burst of radio waves” that had hit the Murriyang telescope at the CSIRO Parkes Observatory. The source, they figured, had to be a trillion times brighter". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
